intro: Rhaptostylum salicifolium, commonly known as the willow-leaved rhaptostylum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that resemble those of willow species. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Rhaptostylum salicifolium is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
